spell.name: Building Pressure

entries.name: Saving Throw
entries: Strength halves

You bring the immense pressures of Aquestio's depths to bear on an open space, conjuring a 30-foot radius, 100-foot high cylinder centered on a point within range. This area becomes a zone of harsh pressure, and at the start of each of your turns you can choose to amplify the pressure by one step.

items.name: Harsh Pressure
entries: Each 5 feet moved through the area costs 10 feet of movement. When a creature starts its turn in the area or enters the area for the first time on a turn it makes a Strength saving throw. On a failure, it takes {@dice 4d6} bludgeoning damage and if it's flying it immediately starts falling. On a success, it only takes half damage.

items.name: Heavy Pressure
entries: As harsh pressure, but the damage increases to {@dice 6d6}.

items.name: Extreme Pressure
entries: As heavy pressure, but falling damage is doubled in the area, and flying creatures have disadvantage on the saving throw.

items.name: Deadly Pressure
entries: As extreme pressure, but each 5 feet moved through the area costs 20 feet of movement, the damage increases to {@dice 8d6}, and at the end of each of your turns while concentrating, you suffer a level of {@condition strife|LevelUp}.

spell.name: Conjure Shadows

components.m: shadow puppet of paper or other material for each creature summoned

entries: You craft 3 creatures from the shadowstuff of the Bleak Gate in unoccupied spaces you can see. The creatures can take different shapes of your choosing, but they use the statistics of {@creature shadow|LevelUp|shadows} that cannot create new shadows.

Shadows summoned this way are allied to you and your companions. While it is within 60 feet you can use a bonus action to mentally command summoned shadow. When you command multiple shadows using this spell, you must give them all the same command. You may decide the action the shadows takes and where they move during their next turn, or you can issue a general command, such as guardian an area. If not given a command, a shadow remains within 60 feet of you and attacks the nearest living creature that is not your ally.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: You can conjure an additional shadow for each slot level above 4th. In place of 4 creatures, you can instead conjure a shade that uses the statistics of a {@creature shadow dragon wyrmling|LevelUp}.

spell.name: Exposure of Drunath

entries.name: Area
entries: 1-mile radius circle

You open a pinprick to the plane of Drunath directly above you and wash the area in its solar energies. Roll {@dice 1d20} and refer to Table: Exposure of Drunath to determine how the area is affected. If you are under the effects of the {@spell calculate|LevelUp} cantrip when casting this spell, you may increase or lower the {@dice d20} result by an amount determined by your level (9th-10th level: {@dice 1d4}, 11th-16th level: {@dice 1d6}, 17th-20th level: {@dice 1d8}.

entries.caption: Exposure of Drunath
rows: Extreme heat and high gravity. In addition, saving throws against extreme heat have disadvantage and cannot benefit from expertise dice.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a 7th-level spell slot, the area increases to a 5-mile radius circle. When using a 9th-level spell slot, the area increases to a 10-mile radius circle.

spell.name: Golden Weapon

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature with a free hand

A golden melee weapon of your choice teleports from the vaults of Valhal into the target's hand, remaining for the duration. It disappears if the target drops it, but a bonus action can be used to recall it.

The target gains a +1 magical bonus to attack and damage rolls made with the golden weapon, and it shines with a golden aura that casts bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for another 20 feet.

The target is proficient with the golden weapon as long as it is wielded. In addition, while the target is wielding the golden weapon, once per turn it can use any {@filter Unending Wheel combat maneuver of 2nd degree or lower|spells|Subschool=unending wheel|level=1;2} without spending exertion. The target does not need to know the Unending Wheel tradition or these maneuvers to use them.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a 6th-level spell slot, once per turn the target can use any {@filter Unending Wheel combat maneuver of 3rd degree or lower|spells|Subschool=unending wheel|level=1;2;3} without spending exertion. When using an 8th level spell slot, once per turn the target can use any {@filter Unending Wheel combat maneuver of 4th degree or lower|spells|Subschool=unending wheel|level=1;2;3;4} without spending exertion.

spell.name: Gravitoss
entries: You focus and shift your gravitational energy. Choose one of the following effects when casting this spell. As a bonus action, you can change which effect is active.

items.name: Heavy Hand
entries: You gain an expertise die on damage for melee attacks, proficiency with the {@spell Leading Throw|LevelUp} combat maneuver, and you do not have to spend exertion to active it.

items.name: Leapabout
entries: You triple your jumping distance.

items.name: Sidewalk
entries: When you touch a surface such as a wall or ceiling, you can use your reaction to change the direction of your personal gravity and walk on that surface as if it were the ground.

items.name: Steadfast
entries: For the duration, you cannot be knocked {@condition prone} or pushed back.

spell.name: Impose Law

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature

entries.name: Saving Throw
entries: Charisma negates

You draw upon the power of the Echo Emperor to impose lawfulness upon the target. The target gains a criminal aura. The target does not receive saving throws to resist the aura and it cannot be suppressed, but must make a saving throw (see the Criminal Auras table below) when committing a crime to avoid emitting visible kaleidoscopic light that can be seen from 60 feet away. On a substantial failure the target is {@condition rattled|LevelUp} while the aura is visible, or on a failure by 10 or more the target also has disadvantage on ability checks made to commit crimes while the aura is visible.
The durations stack and ability checks made regarding multiple durations use the highest DC between them.

entries.caption: Criminal Auras
rows: Lingering after a funeral, speaking lies, spitting, truancy
Driving unlicensed, openly questioning the Council of Order, public lewdness, trespassing
Breaking and entering, impersonation, minor theft, spreading propaganda
Aiding treason, grand theft, intentional harm, plotting against the state
Directly defying the Council of Order, murder, open rebellion, treason

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: For each spell slot level above 6th, you affect one additional target.

spell.name: Interplanar Vision

components.m: salve made from nixie dust and mud from the Bleak Gate costing 50 gold, consumed by the spell

entries.name: Target
entries: One willing creature

The target closes its eyes and a salve applied to its eyelids augments its vision. When you cast this spell choose one plane adjacent to the one in which the target currently exists. For example, while on the Waking, you might choose the astral, ethereal, faerie (the Dreaming), or shadow (the Bleak Gate) plane. For the duration of the spell the target can see clearly into that plane as if it exists there instead, though it only hears sounds from its current plane. In addition, while on Gyre the target can see beyond any planar divisions that separate one region from another.

The target can still see things on its current plane of existence, but everything looks desaturated and its vision is lightly obscured beyond 30 feet. As a bonus action, the target can shift its focus and concentration to its current plane of existence, reversing the visibility (clear in its current plane while desaturated and lightly obscured beyond 30 feet in the adjacent plane).

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: For each slot level above 5th, you can target an additional creature. Each target requires its own material component.

spell.name: Planar Disruption

components.m: diamond worth at least 500 gold, consumed by the spell

entries.name: Area
entries: 50-foot radius sphere

You reach into the distant past or far future to where the realm is unformed and make everything nearby resemble the disrupted plane of Darakoa. The area becomes a void filled with up to 8 hemispherical stone platforms that float around a 15-foot diameter stationary rock you stand upon.

items.name: Floating Platforms
entries: The spell creates at least 5 platforms each of which is between 5 feet in diameter to 10 feet in diameter, and appear underneath any creatures in the area. The platforms rotate around the stationary rock, each moving between 10 feet and 20 feet at the end of each round.

items.name: Jumping and Falling
entries: A creature attempting to leap from a platform to travel further inside has to make an Acrobatics or Athletics check. On a failure it hits a platform and must climb up with an Athletics check to avoid falling off, or on a substantial failure on its check to jump it simply falls into the void.

items.name: Spells and Attacks
entries: Spells cast from outside of the area strike a floating platform before hitting a target on the stationary rock, creatures on the stationary rock gain half cover from attacks made outside of the area, and attacks made while on a floating platform have disadvantage.
At the end of the spell's duration any creatures in the area safely land on the reformed ground and creatures falling into the void reappear in unoccupied spaces below or above where they fell.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a spell slot of 8th level, the duration increases to 1 day. When using a spell slot of 9th level, the duration increases to 1 week.

spell.name: Rapid Evolution

components.m: vial of blood from a shapechanger

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature
The magics of Xyclione grant the target a metamorphosis of its choice from the following list:

items.name: Adapt
entries: The target chooses one ability score, gaining advantage on saving throws using that ability score.

items.name: Fortify
entries: The target gains temporary hit points equal to {@dice 2d6} + your spellcasting ability modifier.

items.name: Grow
entries: The target grows by one size category. Its size doubles in all dimensions and its weight increases eight-fold. It gains advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The target's weapons also enlarge, dealing an extra {@dice 1d4} damage.

items.name: Swiftness
entries: The target's Speed increases by 15 feet.

At the start of its turn, the target can change its metamorphosis to another option from this list. However, it can't return to an option that it has already used previously during this casting of the spell.

spell.name: Sandblast

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature or object

With a sharp gesture you lash out toward your target and smash it with searing hot sand. Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, you deal {@dice 1d4} bludgeoning damage and {@dice 1d4} fire damage. A creature's damage resistance does not reduce any of this damage unless it is resistant to both bludgeoning and fire damage. Immunity to bludgeoning or fire damage is instead treated as damage resistance, unless a creature is immune to both bludgeoning and fire damage.

This spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d4} bludgeoning and {@dice 1d4} fire damage when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d4} and {@dice 2d4}), 11th level ({@dice 3d4} and {@dice 3d4}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d4} and {@dice 4d4}).

spell.name: Skyward

entries.name: Target
entries: One creature or object

entries.name: Saving Throw
entries: Strength negates

You call upon the winds of Guncalta to send the target skyward, flinging it 40 feet directly upwards where it hangs until the start of its next turn. If it has something anchored nearby to grab onto, the target can use its reaction to gain advantage on this saving throw, or if it's already anchored to the ground it automatically succeeds. If there's not enough room for it to fly the full 40 feet upwards, the target is launched as far as possible before colliding, taking {@dice 1d6} bludgeoning damage for each additional 10 feet it would have traveled.
At the start of its next turn, the target falls if it has no way to remain aloft.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd-level or higher, the distance the target is launched increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Summon Forgotten God

components.m: ancient scripture or sacred relic, consumed by the spell

entries: You summon a {@creature forgotten god|LevelUp} eager to escape from the horrors of Ambitio. The forgotten god is friendly to you and your companions and takes its turn immediately after yours.

While the forgotten god is under your control, you establish a telepathic link with it while you are on the same plane. You may issue commands through this link and the forgotten god does its best to obey. No action is required to issue commands, which can be a simple and general course of action such as 'attack that target', 'go over there', or 'bring me that object'. Without commands the forgotten god only defends itself. The forgotten god continues to follow a command until its task is complete.

You can use your action to assume direct control of the forgotten god. Until the end of your next turn, you decide all of the forgotten god's actions and it does nothing you do not allow it to. While a forgotten god is directly controlled in this way, you can also cause it to use Legendary Actions. As long as it is within this range, you can see through the forgotten god's eyes and hear through its ears, gaining the benefit of any special senses it has.

The forgotten god disappears when reduced to 0 hit points. If your concentration is broken before the spell ends, you lose control of the forgotten god, which may become hostile and attack you and your companions or simply flee. An uncontrolled forgotten god disappears 1 hour after you summoned it.

spell.name: Transform Head

entries.name: Target
entries: One humanoid with at least 1 hit point that is not a shapechanger

entries.name: Saving Throw
entries: Wisdom negates

The target's head transforms into the same item used as a material component for this spell. For the duration it has disadvantage on Perception checks, and on Deception, Insight, Intimidation, and Persuasion checks made against humanoids. In addition, when the target becomes bloodied it also becomes {@condition rattled|LevelUp}.
A {@spell remove curse|LevelUp} spell ends the effect if the spell slot used to cast it is equal to or greater than the spell slot used to cast transform head.

entriesHigherLevel.name: Cast at Higher Levels
entries: When using a spell slot of 5th level, the duration increases to 1 week. When using a spell slot of 7th level, the duration increases to 1 month. When using a spell slot of 9th level, the duration increases to 1 year.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The root regains 1 hit point at the start of its turn. If the root takes fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the root's next turn. The root dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

action.name: Vine
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 0} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the root can grapple the target (escape {@dc 9}).

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The nixie has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Faerie Light
entries: As a bonus action, the nixie can cast dim light for 30 feet, or extinguish the glow.

action.name: Ice Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 10/30 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) cold damage.

action.name: Blessed Dusting (3/Day)
entries: The nixie targets a willing creature within 30 feet. The target gains one of the following benefits for 1 hour:

items: Innately cast {@spell haste|LevelUp} (self only) once without the need of spell components or spell slots.
Gain proficiency with Aquan and Sylvan.

action.name: Cursed Dusting
entries: The nixie targets a creature within 30 feet not already affected by a Cursed Dusting. The target makes a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or is subjected to a special magical curse for 1 minute. The curse ends if the nixie dies or is {@condition incapacitated}, the nixie or one of its allies deals damage to the target, or the nixie spends an action to end the curse. Spells such as {@spell dispel magic|LevelUp}, {@spell lesser restoration|LevelUp}, and {@spell remove curse|LevelUp} also end the curse. If a creature makes its saving throw or the condition ends for it, it is immune to any Cursed Dusting for the next 24 hours. When the target fails its saving throw against this effect, the nixie chooses one of the following effects:

items: The target is {@condition frightened} by the nixie.

The target's head takes on the appearance of an aquatic beast's head (fish, octopus, or similar). The target's statistics don't change, but the target can only breathe water and cannot speak, only make any noises the beast may make.

bonus.name: Haste (Recharge 5-6)
entries: For 1 minute while concentrating (as if on a spell) the nixie's Speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to AC, it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it gains one additional action on each of its turns. This action can be used to make a single weapon attack, or to take the Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The illusion's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The illusion has advantage on melee attack rolls against creatures that don't have all their hit points.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The illusion can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Topaz Core
entries: The illusion has advantage on saving throws against transmutation spells but disadvantage on saving throws against all other spells. The illusion is immediately destroyed when it has taken 20 or more damage from critical hits.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage. If the illusion moves at least 20 feet straight towards the target before the attack, the attack deals an extra 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage and the target makes a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or falls {@condition prone}.

action.name: Shapeshift
entries: The illusion polymorphs into a creature or object of Medium or Small size, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment is not transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies, dissipating to leave only its gemstone core.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The illusion's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The illusion's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The illusion can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Diamond Core
entries: The illusion has advantage on saving throws against divination spells but disadvantage on saving throws against all other spells. The illusion is immediately destroyed when it has taken 20 or more damage from critical hits.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) radiant damage.

action.name: Shapeshift
entries: The illusion polymorphs into a creature or object of Medium or Small size, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment is not transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies, dissipating to leave only its gemstone core.

trait.name: Air Body
entries: The illusion can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there, and it can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Frozen Body
entries: A creature that touches the illusion or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) cold damage.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The illusion can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Sapphire Core
entries: The illusion has advantage on saving throws against enchantment spells but disadvantage on saving throws against all other spells. The illusion is immediately destroyed when it has taken 20 or more damage from critical hits.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Shapeshift
entries: The illusion polymorphs into a creature or object of Medium or Small size, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment is not transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies, dissipating to leave only its gemstone core.

action.name: Whirlwind (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The illusion takes the form of a whirlwind, flies up to half of its fly speed without provoking opportunity attacks, and then resumes its normal form. When a creature shares its space with the whirlwind for the first time during this movement, that creature makes a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw. On a failure, the creature is carried inside the illusion's space until the whirlwind ends, taking 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage for each 10 feet it is carried, and falls {@condition prone} at the end of the movement. The whirlwind can carry one Large creature or up to four Medium or smaller creatures.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The illusion's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The illusion can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Emerald Core
entries: The illusion has advantage on saving throws against conjuration spells but disadvantage on saving throws against all other spells. The illusion is immediately destroyed when it has taken 20 or more damage from critical hits.

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Shapeshift
entries: The illusion polymorphs into a creature or object of Medium or Small size, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment is not transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies, dissipating to leave only its gemstone core.

action.name: Invisibility
entries: The illusion magically turns {@condition invisible} until it attacks or casts a spell, or until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the illusion wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The illusion can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Ruby Core
entries: The illusion has advantage on saving throws against evocation spells but disadvantage on saving throws against all other spells. The illusion is immediately destroyed when it has taken 20 or more damage from critical hits.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During the first turn of combat, the illusion has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't acted. On a successful hit, each creature of the illusion's choice that can see the illusion's attack is {@condition rattled|LevelUp} until the end of the illusion's next turn.

trait.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries: While the illusion remains motionless, it is indisitinguishable from a normal object.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The illusion makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shapeshift
entries: The illusion polymorphs into a creature or object of Medium or Small size, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment is not transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies, dissipating to leave only its gemstone core.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The ravel larva can see into both the Waking and Ethereal Veil.

trait.name: Incorporeal
entries: The ravel larva can move through creatures and objects. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Nondetection
entries: The ravel larva is hidden from divination magic and cannot be perceived by magical scrying sensors.

action.name: Proboscis
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage, and the ravel larva attaches to the target. A creature can use an action to detach it, and it can detach itself as a bonus action.

action.name: Charming Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 0 ft., one creature the ravel larva is attached to. {@h}The creature becomes {@condition charmed} by the ravel larva (as the {@spell charm monster|LevelUp} spell; save {@dc 12}) until it is no longer attached.

action.name: Ethereal Jaunt
entries: The ravel larva magically shifts from the Waking to the Ethereal Veil or vice versa. If it wishes, it can be visible to creatures on one plane while on the other.

action.name: Fateful Burrow
entries: If the ravel larva is attached to a {@creature fateholder|LevelUp} it digs down into the arachnid's body dealing 4 ({@damage 1d8}) ongoing damage. This ongoing damage continues for 7 ({@dice 2d6}) rounds as the ravel larva burrows towards the fateholder's skull, at which point the fateholder and ravel larva immediately die only to rise again as a joined {@creature unraveled|LevelUp} 1 minute later. The ravel larva can be removed before killing its host by making a Medicine check ({@dc 10} + 1 per round of ongoing damage) using a weapon that deals piercing damage, or with disadvantage if using a weapon that deals slashing damage.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The shadow pirate can pass through an opening as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Shadow Sneak
entries: The shadow pirate can take the Hide action even while obscured only by dim light or darkness.

trait.name: Sunlight Weakness
entries: While in sunlight, the shadow pirate has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The illusion's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 12}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The illusion can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Onyx Core
entries: The illusion has advantage on saving throws against necromancy spells but disadvantage on saving throws against all other spells. The illusion is immediately destroyed when it has taken 20 or more damage from critical hits.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This effect lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Shapeshift
entries: The illusion polymorphs into a creature or object of Medium or Small size, or back into its true form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment is not transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies, dissipating to leave only its gemstone core.

trait.name: Cloud Walk
entries: The cloud spider can walk on clouds as if they were a solid surface.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The cloud spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the cloud spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The cloud spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Web (Recharge 4-6)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 300/600 ft., one target. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} by webbing (escape {@dc 13}). The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10, 20 hit points, immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage), but the webbing is completely transparent and attacks against it have disadvantage. Spotting the webbing before running into it requires a {@dc 17} Perception check.

trait.name: Deep Rooted (1/Day)
entries: When it is reduced to 0 hit points while in contact with the ground, the foundro is instead reduced to 1 hit point and burrows into a 5-foot square patch of earth within 20 feet. If it cannot root itself, the foundro dies.
While rooted the foundro is {@condition incapacitated} and {@condition staggered|LevelUp} and regains {@dice 1d4} hit points each round until it is no longer bloodied.

Spotting an area where a foundro is rooted requires a {@dc 12} Perception check, and a {@dc 12} Investigation check searching a 5-foot square is needed to find it. Unearthing a rooted foundro requires a {@dc 13} Strength check and {@dice 1d4} rounds (or 1 round on a substantial success). A creature using a shovel has advantage on this check. When the foundro is reduced to 0 hit points while rooted it explodes in a 15-foot radius wave of energy. Each creature in the area makes a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage on a failure, or half damage on a success.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The foundro attacks three times with its vines and once with disruptive pollen.

action.name: Vines
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 13}). Instead of grappling the target, the foundro can choose to knock the target {@condition prone} if it fails a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw.

action.name: Disruptive Pollen
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}The creature makes a Constitution saving throw ({@dc 12} + 1 per previous successful save). On its first failure a creature's senses go awry and it becomes {@condition rattled|LevelUp}. On its second failed saving throw a creature is {@condition poisoned}. On its third failed saving throw, a creature is {@condition charmed} by the foundro. On its turn a creature can use a bonus action to make a new saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Defile (While Bloodied)
entries: The foundro can use a bonus action to defile the ground in a 15-foot radius around it, regaining 9 ({@dice 2d8}) hit points. Without the effects of a {@spell hallow|LevelUp} spell, a defiled area becomes infertile and cannot be cultivated for {@dice 1d4} years.

bonus.name: Vine Drag
entries: If the foundro takes the Dash action and is not grappling any creatures or burrowing, it can move an additional 20 feet.

monster.name: Knutadraugr
languages: understands languages it knew in life but can't speak

trait.name: Chilling Stare (Gaze)
entries: A creature within 120 feet makes a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or becomes {@condition frightened} for {@dice 1d4} rounds. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the knutadraugr's Chilling Stare for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knutadraugr attacks twice.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Handaxe (4)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Freezing Glare
entries: The knutadraugr's eyes glimmer at a creature {@condition frightened} by its Chilling Stare, extending the fear's duration by 2 ({@dice 1d4}) rounds if the creature fails a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The actor deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when they hit with a weapon attack while they have advantage on the attack, or when the actor's target is within 5 feet of an ally of the actor while the actor doesn't have disadvantage on the attack.

action.name: Dagger (3)
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Painful Words
entries: The actor chooses a creature within 60 feet that can hear and understand it, forcing the target to make a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw. On a failure the target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage and averts its eyes from the actor until the start of the actor's next turn. While the target's eyes are averted, it cannot see the actor.

trait.name: Fire Form
entries: A creature that touches the blazing spider or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) ongoing fire damage until an action is used to put out the flames.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The blazing spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Water Susceptibility
entries: For every 5 feet the blazing spider moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damage.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the blazing spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The blazing spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) fire damage and the target makes a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failure the creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage and is {@condition poisoned}, or on a success it instead takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Web (Recharge 4-6)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} by webbing (escape {@dc 13}). After escaping the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) ongoing fire damage until an action is used to put out the flames. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10, 10 hit points, vulnerable to cold damage, immune to fire, bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage).

spellcasting.name: Psionic Spellcasting
headerEntries: The brainling's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The deva has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Ectoplasmic Shell
entries: The brainling is immune to extra damage from critical hits and sneak attack damage.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: When the brainling makes a Dexterity saving throw against an effect that deals half damage on a success, it takes no damage on a success and half damage on a failure.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The brainling regains 5 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The brainling attacks twice.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Brain Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 50/100 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) psychic damage.

action.name: Brain Drain
entries: The brainling focuses its mind on a {@condition debilitated|LevelUp} creature it can see within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Intelligence saving throw or its Intelligence score is reduced by {@dice 1d4}. The target is permanently {@condition debilitated|LevelUp} if this reduces its Intelligence score to 0. Otherwise, the condition lasts until the brainling is slain, or {@spell greater restoration|LevelUp} or similar magic is cast on the target. At the end of a long rest the target makes a {@dc 13} Intelligence saving throw, ending the reduction and {@condition debilitated|LevelUp} condition on a success.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: A carrionette does not need to eat, breathe, or sleep.

trait.name: Disquieting Death
entries: Creatures within 30 feet of a carrionette and able to see it have disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls. Carrionettes and undead are immune to this effect.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While motionless, a carrionette is indistinguishable from a corpse.

trait.name: Mangled
entries: Rigor mortis makes it impossible for carrionettes to manipulate objects or wield weapons.

action.name: Smash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Incredible Smell
entries: The dire fly has advantage and gains a {@dice 1d8} expertise die on Perception checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Digestive Spit
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) acid damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

bonus.name: Aerial Dodge
entries: The dire fly makes a {@dc 15} Acrobatics check, taking the Dodge action on a success.

reaction.name: Zoom (Recharge 4-6)
entries: When an attack misses the dire fly while it is airborne, it flies up to 25 feet without provoking opportunity attacks.

trait.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries: While the swarm remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from ordinary Tiny objects.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny monstrosity. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage if the swarm is bloodied.

action.name: Shapeshift
entries: The swarm polymorphs into Tiny objects or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment is not transformed. The swarm reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The tiger has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Angelic Weapons
entries: The tiger's weapon attacks are magical. When it hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Good
entries: The tiger radiates a Good aura.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The tiger has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage. If the tiger moves at least 20 feet straight towards the target before the attack, the target makes a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw, falling {@condition prone} on a failure.

bonus.name: Opportune Bite
entries: The tiger makes a bite attack against a {@condition prone} creature.

trait.name: Chromatic Chitin
entries: When the scorpion is subjected to fire damage its body emits distracting bursts of colourful light. Until the start of its next turn the scorpion's AC increases by 3 against creatures able to see it without the use of blindsight or tremorsense.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The scorpion attacks once with its claws and once with its sting.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). If the target is Large-sized or bigger, until this grapple ends the scorpion can't attack a different target with its claws.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage and the target makes a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 3d10}) poison damage on a failure or half damage on a success.

resist.note: from spells and other magical effects

trait.name: Thoughtflesh
entries: Normally a gidim is incorporeal, perceived as real but with no physical substance. It can move through creatures and objects. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage if it ends its turn inside an object. When it takes psychic damage, until the end of its attacker's next turn the gidim loses this trait and its damage immunities and resistances.

trait.name: Willbending
entries: A creature can use an action to think at a gidim within 60 feet and impose its will. The creature makes a spell attack using Intelligence as its spellcasting ability modifier, choosing one of the following options on a hit.

items: The attack deals {@damage 1d6} psychic damage to the gidim.
The gidim cannot perceive the creature until the end of the attacker's next turn.
The creature moves the gidim 10 feet in any direction.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gidim attacks once with its claws and once with Mind Thrust. Then it can also command up to one creature it has dealt psychic damage to since the start of its last turn.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) psychic damage (or slashing damage if the gidim is corporeal).

action.name: Command
entries: The gidim tries to impose control on a creature (as the {@spell command|LevelUp} spell; save {@dc 14}).

action.name: Consume Mind
entries: The gidim chooses an {@condition unconscious} creature within 5 feet. The gidim loses its Thoughtflesh trait until the start of its next turn as it begins to unhinge the creatures jaw to reach the brain through the palate of its victim's mouth. If the creature is still within reach at the start of the gidim's next turn it takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) bludgeoning damage. When the gidim kills a creature this way it regains 45 hit points and learns everything its victim knew.

action.name: Mind Thrust
entries: One creature within 60 feet makes a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or it takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage and is moved 10 feet in a direction of the gidim's choice.

trait.name: Charger
entries: The goatrilla can move through the space of any creature that is Medium or smaller when it moves at least 20 feet in a straight line.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The goatrilla attacks once with its horns, once with its bite, and once with its fists. Alternatively, the goatrilla can use its roar in place of its horns or bite. It cannot attack the same target with both its horns and bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Fists
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Horns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it makes a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or is knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Roar (Recharge 6)
entries: The goatrilla unleashes a powerful roar in a 15-foot cone. Creatures in the area make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) force damage and become {@condition debilitated|LevelUp} until the end of the goatrilla's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half damage and isn't {@condition debilitated|LevelUp}.

bonus.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Flammable
entries: After taking fire damage, the knight catches fire and takes ongoing 11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage if it isn't already suffering ongoing fire damage. It can spend an action or bonus action to extinguish this fire.

trait.name: Fungal Weaponry
entries: The knight's weapon attacks are magical, and it deals an extra 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage with weapon attacks (included below).

trait.name: Glamered
entries: The knight appears to be a normal humanoid until it is bloodied, smells an overwhelming odor of garlic or vinegar, or is infuriated by a successful Persuasion check opposed by its Insight check.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The knight has advantage on Perception checks that rely on smell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight attacks three times.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) magical slashing damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

action.name: +1 Greatclub
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) magical bludgeoning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Lobbing Spores
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 90/360 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) magical bludgeoning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) necrotic damage and 2 ({@damage 1d4}) poison damage.

bonus.name: Lobbing Spores
entries: The knight causes {@dice 1d4} precarious growths to appear on the head of its greatclub. Until the knight grows more lobbing spores its blindsight functions through each of them.

reaction.name: Unsettling Appearance (Recharge 4-6)
entries: After the knight is damage by a humanoid, it can transform its appearance to match the humanoid. This startling psionic response throws attackers off balance, and the humanoid has disadvantage on attacks made against the knight until it uses Unsettling Appearance again.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Combat Expertise
entries: The damage of the knight's attacks includes a {@dice d4} expertise die.

trait.name: Detect Magic
entries: The knight senses a magical aura around any visible creature or object within 120 feet that bears magic.

trait.name: Glamered
entries: Until it is bloodied or laughs because of a successful Performance check opposed by its Intimidation check, the knight and its mount appear to be a normal humanoid knight and warhorse.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: When the knight makes a Dexterity saving throw against an effect that deals half damage on a success, it takes no damage on a success and half damage on a failure.

trait.name: Mounted
entries: The knight rides a four-legged aberration able to sniff out magic (use the statistics of a {@creature chuul|LevelUp} with a speed of 45 feet).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight attacks three times.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: The knight takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

reaction.name: Spellshatter Charge (5/Short Rest)
entries: When the knight sees a creature casting a spell, it can move up to 30 feet. If it ends its movement adjacent to that creature, the knight can make a melee weapon attack against it. On a hit, the creature makes a Wisdom saving throw against the knight's maneuver DC or the spell is interrupted (expending the spell slot) and has no effect.

reaction.name: Magic Negative (1/Day)
entries: When the knight hits a creature with a melee weapon attack, it can sever the creature's connection to magic. For the next 3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) rounds the creature is affected as if in an {@spell antimagic field|LevelUp}. The creature makes a {@dc 14} Charisma saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Bloodtracker
entries: After damaging a living creature with its halberd the knight knows the direction and distance to it as long as they are on the same plane of existence.

trait.name: Glamered
entries: The knight appears to be a normal humanoid until it is bloodied, damages a bloodied creature, or is infuriated by a successful Stealth check opposed by its Perception check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight attacks three times.

action.name: Halberd
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) magical slashing damage.

action.name: Ram (Bloodied Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) magical bludgeoning damage and the target makes a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or is knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Halberd Slash
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 50/150 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) thunder damage.

bonus.name: Practised Sweep
entries: When the knight hits a creature twice on the same turn with its halberd, it uses the {@spell Knockdown|LevelUp} basic maneuver against the creature.

bonus.name: Monstrous Tentacle (Bloodied Only)
entries: The knight uses the {@spell Disarm|LevelUp} or {@spell Knockdown|LevelUp} basic maneuver.

bonus.name: Sanguine Shield (Recharge 5-6)
entries: After the knight hits a living creature with its halberd it captures the blood in mid-air to form a floating shield around it. Until the start of the knight's next turn its Armour Class increases by 3.

reaction.name: Heart Strike (1/Day)
entries: When the knight uses its halberd to make a melee weapon attack against a living creature and hits, it can swivel the blade of the weapon to turn the attack into a critical hit.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Mounted
entries: The knight rides a {@creature skeletal warhorse|LevelUp}.

trait.name: Glamered
entries: Until it is bloodied or infuriated by a successful Intimidation check opposed by its Insight check, the knight and its mount appear to be a normal humanoid knight and warhorse.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The knight doesn't require air, sustenance, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight attacks three times.

action.name: Spade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Spade Slash
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) necrotic damage.

bonus.name: Spade Magic (Recharge 4-6)
entries: The knight reshapes a 5-foot cube adjacent to it, changing the area's elevation or creating and eliminating holes, walls, and pillars. Changes that result in unstable terrain are subject to collapse. Any Large-sized or smaller creature in the area makes a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or falls {@condition prone} in a square chosen by the knight that is adjacent to the area. If the chosen square is occupied by a creature of Medium size or smaller, it makes a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or also falls {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Unforgiving Hilt
entries: When the knight hits a creature twice on the same turn with its spade, it uses the {@spell Shove|LevelUp} basic maneuver against the creature.

bonus.name: Dig In
entries: The knight attacks a {@condition prone} creature with its spade.

trait.name: Water Walk
entries: The littoral spider can walk on water as if it were a solid surface.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The littoral spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the littoral spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The littoral spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

trait.name: Translucent
entries: Creatures that rely on sight have disadvantage on attack rolls against the littoral spider.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The littoral spider attacks twice with its slam.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) cold damage and the target makes a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or is {@condition poisoned} for 3 ({@dice 1d6}) turns.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Web (Recharge 4-6)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} by webbing (escape {@dc 16}). The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10, 10 hit points, immunity to bludgeoning, poison, and psychic damage), but like the littoral spider it is translucent and attacks against it have disadvantage.

trait.name: Agile Movement
entries: The metal wolf had advantage on Athletics checks made to jump.

trait.name: Apex Armour
entries: The metal wolf's carrying capacity doubles, it reduces falling damage by 30, and it is immune to all gas-based attacks.
In addition, the metal wolf ignores the first 5 points of damage whenever it takes non-psychic damage.

trait.name: Apex Tracker
entries: The metal wolf can consume the blood or flesh of a creature to learn about its prey. At the end of the next round, the metal wolf instantly recalls the last minute of a creature's memories immediately before it was last wounded or died. For the next 24 hours the metal wolf gains advantage on Survival checks made to track the creature.

trait.name: Fighting Style: Archery
entries: The metal wolf gains a +2 bonus to attack rolls with ranged weapons (included below).

trait.name: Resist Sickness
entries: The metal wolf has advantage on saving throws against diseases and poison.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The metal wolf attacks twice.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Apex Slug Thrower
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 300/600 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) thunder damage.

bonus.name: Autofire
entries: The metal wolf makes a ranged attack with its apex slug thrower with disadvantage.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries: The pale striganes has advantage on Perception checks that rely on hearing and sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pale striganes makes a Fearsome Hoot or Debilitating Screech. It then attacks twice with its talons.

action.name: Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Essence Drain
entries: The pale striganes focuses its mind on a {@condition debilitated|LevelUp} creature it can see within 30 feet. The target must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or the highest of its mental ability scores (Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma) is reduced by {@dice 1d6}. The target is permanently {@condition debilitated|LevelUp} if this reduces any mental ability score to 0. Otherwise, the condition lasts until the pale striganes is slain, or {@spell greater restoration|LevelUp} or similar magic is cast on the target. At the end of a long rest the target makes a {@dc 13} saving throw using the reduced ability score, ending the reduction and {@condition debilitated|LevelUp} condition on a success.

action.name: Fearsome Hoot
entries: The pale striganes releases an eerie hoot that resonates in a 30-foot radius. Any other living creature within the area makes a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or throws down whatever it is holding and becomes {@condition frightened} for 1 minute.

While {@condition frightened} by the fearsome hoot, a creature must use its full movement to move away from the pale striganes by the safest available route on each of its turns unless there is nowhere to move. If a creature ends its turn where it doesn't have line of sight to the pale striganes, it can make another Wisdom saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success.

action.name: Debilitating Screech
entries: The pale striganes utters a terrible piercing scream at a creature within 10 feet. The target  must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or take 20 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage and be {@condition debilitated|LevelUp} for 1 minute. A {@condition debilitated|LevelUp} creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Sense Essence
entries: The pale striganes measures mental prowess, sensing the Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores of all living creatures it can see within 100 feet.

trait.name: False Appearance (Object Form Only)
entries: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary object.

trait.name: Adhesive (Object Form Only)
entries: The mimic adheres to anything that touches it. A Huge or smaller creature adhered to the mimic is also {@condition grappled} by it (escape {@dc 15}).

trait.name: Grappler
entries: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature {@condition grappled} by it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mimic attacks twice, or attacks once and uses Swallow.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) acid damage.

action.name: Shapeshift
entries: The mimic polymorphs into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment is not transformed. The mimic reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in object form the target is subjected to the mimic's Adhesive trait.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The mimic makes one bite attack against a Medium or smaller target it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target is also swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the target is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the mimic, and it takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage at the start of each of the mimic's turns. The mimic can have up to two creatures swallowed at a time.

If the mimic takes 20 damage or more in a single turn from a swallowed creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate the creature, which falls {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the mimic. If the mimic dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} and can escape from the mimic's corpse by using 5 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Inured to Death
entries: Rustshot is immune to the effects of the Disquieting Death trait.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Rustshot attacks three times.

action.name: Shoot Em!
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60/80 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The detective is a 5th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, +5 to hit with spell attacks). They can cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Evasion
entries: When the detective makes a Dexterity saving throw against an effect that deals half damage on a success, they take no damage on a success and half damage on a failure.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The detective deals an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage when they hit with a weapon attack while they have advantage on the attack, or when the detective's target is within 5 feet of an ally of the detective while the detective doesn't have disadvantageon the attack.

trait.name: Urban Investigator
entries: The detective knows the streets as well as the ins and outs of investigation in a city, and they gain advantage on Insight, Investigation, and Persuasion checks made to investigate crimes.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The detective attacks three times: once with their +1 rapier and twice with their dagger.

action.name: +1 Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) magical piercing damage.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Cunning Action (1/Turn)
entries: The detective takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: When an attacker the detective can see hits them with an attack, the detective halves the attack's damage against them.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: So long as the geode spider remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a boulder or other natural rock formation.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The geode spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the geode spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The geode spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The geode spider makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Web (Recharge 4-6)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained} by webbing (escape {@dc 15}) and makes a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or becomes {@condition petrified}. When a creature starts its turn in contact with the web it makes a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or becomes {@condition petrified}. The webbing can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10, 20 hit points, immunity to bludgeoning, fire, poison, and psychic damage).

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The psionic brain's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, +8 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Thrall Control
entries: On its turn the psionic brain issues commands to up to 3 of its thralls.

trait.name: Thralls
entries: The psionic brain can control up to 5 thralls. Unless noted otherwise, thralls use the statistics for {@creature thug|LevelUp|thugs} and cannot take reactions. A thrall takes only the actions the psionic brain chooses, it does not need to share a language to understand its directions, and it doesn't do anything that the psionic brain doesn't allow it to do. Thralls are permanently {@condition charmed}, but at the end of each long rest make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw, ending the permanency of the {@condition charmed} condition on a success.

action.name: Multiple Actions
entries: The psionic brain uses two of the following actions.

action.name: Mental Charm
entries: The psionic brain presses upon the mind of a creature within 30 feet forcing it to make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition charmed}. At the start of each of its turns a {@condition charmed} creature repeats the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the psionic brain's Mental Charm for 1 hour.

action.name: Mind Crush
entries: The psionic brain deals a psychic blow to a creature it can sense within 120 feet. The target makes a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw, taking 12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) psychic damage on a failure, or half damage on a success.

action.name: Mind Scream (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The psionic brain unleashes a telepathic scream in the minds of its enemies within 120 feet. Each creature in the area that is not a thrall or {@condition charmed} to the psionic brain takes 12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) psychic damage.

action.name: Static Slash
entries: The psionic brain discharges an electric jolt at a creature or object it can see within 30 feet. The target makes a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) lightning damage on a failure, or half damage on a success.

bonus.name: Enthrall
entries: The psionic brain makes a creature {@condition charmed} by it one of its thralls.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The sisao has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Shimmering Form
entries: The sisao's body shimmers like a heat distortion. Creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls against the sisao. An attacker is immune to this effect if it doesn't rely on sight or can see through illusions. If the sisao takes damage, this trait doesn't function until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: The sisao doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sisao makes two bite attacks or two searing light attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Searing Light
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage and the target makes a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or is {@condition blinded} until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Conjure Mirage
entries: The sisao magically creates the illusion of an oasis, spring, or other body of water in a space that it can see within 60 feet of it. The illusion fills a cube up to 500 feet on a side and lasts until the sisao dies or uses a bonus action to dismiss it. The tactile characteristics of the landscape don't change, so creatures entering the area are likely to see through the illusion. A creature that examines the area without entering it can see through the illusion with a successful {@dc 19} Investigation check. A creature that discerns the illusion for what it is sees a vague image superimposed on the area instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Sendriya has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Angelic Weapons
entries: Sendriya's weapon attacks are magical. When she hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Good
entries: Sendriya radiates a Good aura.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries: Sendriya has advantage on Perception chcks that rely on hearing or sight.

trait.name: Trackless Travel
entries: Sendriya can't be tracked by nonmagical means.

trait.name: Trained Accuracy
entries: Sendriya's weapon attacks deal an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage (included below).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Sendriya attacks twice.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 1d8 + 2d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 1d8 + 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage. This attack ignores half or three-quarters cover, and long range doesn't impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

bonus.name: Aimed Strike
entries: Sendriya gains advantage on her next attack made before the end of her turn.

bonus.name: Skirmish Step
entries: Sendriya moves up to half her Speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

trait.name: Caustic Blood
entries: When the xenid takes damage of any type but psychic, each creature within 5 feet takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) ongoing acid damage until an action is used to scrape off the corrosive blood. This acid damage also causes any worn armour to take a permanent and cumulative -1 penalty to AC. If the penalty reduces its AC to 10 the armour is destroyed.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: When the xenid makes a Dexterity saving throw against an effect that deals half damage on a success, it takes no damage on a success and half damage on a failure.

trait.name: Fire Susceptibility
entries: When the xenid takes fire damage, until the end of its next turn it takes a -2 penalty to AC and Dexterity saving throws, and has disadvantage on attack rolls.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The xenid deals an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage when it hits with an attack while it has advantage on the attack, or when the xenid's target is within 5 feet of an ally of the xenid while it doesn't have disadvantage on the attack.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The xenid can use its climb speed even on difficult surfaces and upside down on ceilings.

trait.name: Vent Crawler
entries: The xenid can move through spaces without squeezing as if it were Medium-sized.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The xenid attacks twice. If it hits with two claw attacks in the same turn against a Medium or smaller target, the target is {@condition grappled} and {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Luring Chitter
entries: When the xenid makes a Perception check it can emit a roiling screech that makes creatures within 100 feet and able to hear it {@condition rattled|LevelUp} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: All-Around Vision
entries: The unraveled cannot be surprised. In addition, it has advantage on sight-based Perception checks and on saving throws against being {@condition blinded}.

trait.name: Ethereal Sight
entries: The unraveled can see into both the Waking and Ethereal Veil.

trait.name: Nondetection
entries: The unraveled is hidden from divination magic and cannot be perceived by magical scrying sensors.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The unraveled can use its climb speed even on difficult surfaces and upside down on ceilings.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The unraveled has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

trait.name: Undead Fortitude (1/Day)
entries: If the unraveled is reduced to 0 hit points by damage that isn't psychic or from a critical hit, it's instead reduced to 1 hit point, falls {@condition prone}, and is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of its next turn, appearing to be dead.

trait.name: Undead Nature
entries: An unraveled doesn't require air, sustenance, or sleep.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The unraveled ignores movement restrictions imposed by webs.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The unraveled attacks once with its bite and twice with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) poison damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, it is infected with {@disease fractured rift disorder|LevelUp}.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Ethereal Jaunt (Recharge 6)
entries: The unraveled magically shifts from the Waking to the Ethereal Veil or vice versa. The unraveled is visible to creatures on one plane while on the other.

action.name: Ethereal Web (Recharge 6)
entries: The unraveled releases ethereal silk in a 60-foot cone like a shadowspinner. The area is filled with ethereal webs (see Planestrider's Journal pg70).

bonus.name: Echo of Fate (3/Day)
entries: The unraveled's twisted psyche spies through possible futures and it gains advantage on its next attack roll.

bonus.name: Incorporeal Hop (Recharge 6)
entries: The unraveled moves up to 15 feet through creatures and objects without provoking opportunity attacks. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The bookseer is a 13th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, +9 to hit with spell attacks). It can cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The bookseer has advantage on saving throws against spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Constructed Nature
entries: A bookseer doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the bookseer remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal book.

trait.name: Magical Tome
entries: The bookseer is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form, requires no material components for its spellcasting, and is {@condition dazed|LevelUp} while within an {@spell antimagic field|LevelUp} but unaffected by {@spell dispel magic|LevelUp}.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

trait.name: False Appearance (Building Form Only)
entries: While the mimic remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary building.

trait.name: Grappler
entries: The mimic has advantage on attack rolls against any creature {@condition grappled} by it.

trait.name: Mimicry
entries: The mimic can mimic animal sounds and humanoid voices. A creature that hears the sounds can tell they are imitations with a {@dc 15} Insight check.

trait.name: Reel (1/Turn)
entries: On its turn, the mimic can pull creatures it has {@condition grappled} up to 30 feet towards it.

trait.name: Trap House (Building Form Only)
entries: Parts of the mimic are covered in an extremely adhesive substance. A Huge or smaller creature that touches one of the mimic's exits is {@condition grappled} by it (escape {@dc 17}).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mimic attacks twice.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage.

action.name: Shapeshift
entries: The mimic polymorphs into an object or back into its true, amorphous form. Its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment is not transformed. The mimic reverts to its true form if it dies.

action.name: Super Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 60 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the mimic is in building form the target is subjected to its Adhesive trait.

action.name: Spew (Recharge 4-6)
entries: The mimic vomits a 30-foot line of acid that is 5-feet wide. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 5d8}) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

bonus.name: Pseudosnatch (Recharge 5-6)
entries: The reach of the mimic's super pseudopod increases by 30 feet until the end of its turn.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While motionless, the treant is indistinguishable from a tree.

trait.name: Flammable
entries: If the treant takes fire damage, it catches fire, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) ongoing fire damage, unless it is already on fire. It can use an action to extinguish itself, ending the ongoing damage.

trait.name: Forest Speaker
entries: The treant can communicate with beasts and plants.

trait.name: Seasonal Shift (4/Day)
entries: The treant draws on fey magic to choose its personal season (winter, spring, summer, or fall) and its related bonus action.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The treant deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The treant makes two attacks, or makes one attack and uses Animate Plant.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 4d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Rock
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 60/180 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Animate Plant
entries: The treant magically animates a Large or larger plant within 60 feet. The plant is immobile, but it acts on the treant's initiative and can make slam attacks, or rock attacks if there are rocks to throw within 10 feet of it. Non-plant creatures treat the ground within 15 feet of the plant as difficult terrain, as surrounding roots conspire to trip and grasp moving creatures. The plant remains animated for 1 hour. If the treant uses this action while it has three plants animated in this way, the plant that has been animated the longest returns to normal.

bonus.name: Bark Up (Winter)
entries: The treant's bark hardens and warps, granting it resistance to cold damage for the next minute. In addition, a creature that touches the treant or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Burst of Pollen (Spring)
entries: Creatures within 10 feet make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw or are {@condition poisoned} for 1 minute. A creature that does not breathe automatically succeeds.
